Nicholas Pavlik
St. Paul's Free Church account book
St. Paul's Free Church account book

Account book of St. Paul's Free Church for the period 1834 to 1840, including treasurer's accounts of income and expenditures; accounts of the minister, vestry, and sexton; and lists of special donations.

Account book of St. Paul's Free Church for the period 1834 to 1840, including treasurer's accounts of income and expenditures; accounts of the minister, vestry, and sexton; and lists of special donations.

Account book of St. Paul's Free Church for the period 1834 to 1840, including treasurer's accounts of income and expenditures; accounts of the minister, vestry, and sexton; and lists of special donations.

St. Paul's Free Church was an Episcopal congregation formed by former members of St. Ann's, Brooklyn's earliest Episcopal church. St. Paul's purchased a building on Pearl Street (later Concord Street), but suspended services in 1840. It reopened later as Calvary Church, but had ceased to exist by 1862.
Gift of Thomas F. De Voe, 1869. Formally accessioned in 1977.
